head.title: Man Killed When Truck Falls Off Gowanus

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Man Killed When Truck Falls Off Gowanus

abstract.p: Truck driver is killed when his truck plummets nearly 40 feet off Gowanus Expressway in Brooklyn and lands on top of livery cab (S)

block.p: A truck driver was killed last night when his truck plummeted nearly 40 feet off the Gowanus Expressway in Brooklyn and landed on top of a livery cab, the police said. The livery driver walked away from the crash.

The trucker, driving a box truck filled with mattresses for S. Persaud Trucking of Queens, was driving north on the elevated expressway around 9:45 p.m. when he lost control and smashed through the guard rail, said Sgt. Elias Nikas, a police spokesman.

The trucker, driving a box truck filled with mattresses for S. Persaud Trucking of Queens, was driving north on the elevated expressway around 9:45 p.m. when he lost control and smashed through the guard rail, said Sgt. Elias Nikas, a police spokesman.
The truck landed on the cab at the corner of Sixth Avenue and 65th Street, Sergeant Nikas said.

The truck driver was declared dead at the scene, and his passenger was in critical condition at Lutheran Hospital, while the livery driver suffered only minor injuries, Sergeant Nikas said. None of the drivers or the passenger's names was released.
